poem:
**The Arc of Influence**  

In the quiet chambers  
of black robes and oak panels,  
power whispers its seduction,  
laying its invisible hand  
on the scales of justice.  
What weight does a conscience bear  
when tilted by the whims  
of a single unpredictable voice,  
writing its own echo  
into the margins of the law?
